titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: left after breakfast: and I settled down to a futile morning of correspondence & promiscuous reading.
I wrote a rather belated letter to
had a number of visitors in the afternoon, including a Colonel & Mrs
brought with him from Durham. I showed them the Chapel.
's society, the G.D.A, only numbered 8. Archdeacon

& his wife came also. I do not quite understand the purpose of the society, but gather that it is a socially select (!) version of the G.F.S. How any living religion can be expected to grow from the root of snobbery is hard to see, but we must "

The weather deteriorated as the afternoon drew towards evening, and anxiety as to the weather on Monday began to shadow my mind. Rawlinson & his wife arrived. He is quite at home with these devotional experiments. I attend compline, but did not stay for the address as I don't want him to get the impression that I am doubtful as to his teaching!
